item.description:
hello everyone,

let's meetup to skate at 1 p.m., sunday, 26 april on cambridge's memorial drive.

we're going to have an absolutely incredible weekend here in the boston area: sunny and highs in the low to mid 80s on both saturday and sunday.

even better, this sunday, 26 april, is the first day on which the massachusetts department of conservation and recreation (dcr) closes memorial drive to automobile traffic between western avenue and mount auburn street from 11 a.m. until 7 p.m. (dcr does this every sunday from the last sunday in april through the first sunday in november.)

so let's take advantage of the great weather by getting together for our first outdoor skate of 2009.

finding me:

i look more or less like my meetup photo and i'll be waiting at western avenue and memorial drive at 1 p.m.

to get a look at my mug, see my profile here: http://www.meetup.com...

in addition, i'll email my cell number to anyone who has rsvp'd Yes or Maybe by 10 a.m., sunday morning. if you can't find me at 1:00 or if you arrive later, call or text and i'll let you know where i am.

also, if you make a Game Time decision to join us after 10 a.m. sunday, then you can still email me at gakable-meetup@yahoo.com to ask for my cell # as i'll receive the email on my blackberry.

other details:

this is a meetup skating event for all skill levels. please feel free to come even if you're new to inline/roller skating and i'll help you as much as i can. if you're an expert, please feel free to take off and kick it hard ... but come on back to us to chat from time to time, too.

i wear protective gear --knee & elbow pads, wrist guards, and helmet (usually)-- but it is completely up to you whether you wear protective gear. if you're curious, ask me to show you some of my gear to give you an idea of how it has saved me from serious road rash, at the very least.

fwiw, note that the most common injuries are blows to the back of the head (beginners are especially likely to fall backward) and broken wrists as one tries to break one's fall. so hey -- caveat skater, but again, protective gear is up to you.

i don't have a firm end time in mind, but i'll commit to skating until 3 p.m. i also don't have anything else planned for this meetup; i.e., no dinner and/or drinks afterward, as we've done sometimes.

(however, i do think that there's no better way to spend a beautiful, sunny afternoon than having a delicious pint in a nice dark bar. so there's that to consider....)

other info:

see this city of cambridge page for information on the memorial drive closure: http://www.cambridgem...

see this dcr page for additional information: http://www.mass.gov/d...

looking forward to meeting you on mem drive!

pwl
item.how_to_find_us: i'll email a cell # to all 'Yes' and 'Maybe' RSVPers on sunday morning
item.name: Let's Skate! Memorial Drive on Sunday.
